flashcards.notes: Common modern greeting/farewell for weekend. Korwoi = have (korwo + i), wikendi = weekend (borrowed from English), njega = good

flashcards.english: Hĩ! Kaĩ kwĩna heho-ĩ! (Lo! It is very cold!), Kaĩ wĩ mũrũaru? (Are you sick?), Wanjũrĩa ũguo nĩkĩ? (Why do you ask me that?), Tondũ gũtirĩ na heho (Because it is not cold), We! Ta ĩkĩra burana (You! Just put on a cardigan), Kwĩna ũrugarĩ (It is hot/warm), Urenda kũrũarara? (Do you want to fall sick?), Ngwĩhũmba burana na kabuti (I will wear a cardigan and an overcoat)
flashcards.notes: Complete weather conversation showing disagreement about temperature. Grammar: Kaĩ turns statement into question, adding 'ĩ' at end makes it emphatic. Cultural note: Mweri wa mũgwanja (July) is usually very cold
